page.title: 12The Kimpton Home's Animals
page.content: {A Typical Day:}10 a.m. The feeding of the animals takes about an hour. The staff clean the single kennels while the dogs take it in turns to run in the outside runs and get their exercise. {Dogs:}80-100 dogs pass through the home in any one month but the actual number on any one day may vary considerably. {Strays:}People who pick up a stray may take it to a police station, where it is kept for a day. If not claimed within that time, it may be taken to the Blue Cross Kennels. {Homeless Dogs:}These are the ones that have obviously been ill treated or abandoned. {The Welfare Category:}These animals are looked after for a short time while their owners are ill, in prison or have died.
